page.title: 05Recreation (cont)
page.content:
the other side of the River Anchor. They are fairly big strips and there are about 100 altogether. My grandad rents two allotments. Like most other people, he grows fruit and vegetables for the family. He has an Anderson air-raid shelter (left over from World War Two) which he uses as a shed. He keeps his gardening tools and some food and drink in it. He needs the food and drink as he is sometimes there all day. It is quite warm and cosy inside the shelter. You will find that it is mostly the older people that rent allotments, which they enjoy and take great pride in.
{Girl Guides I belong to the 2nd Nuneaton Guides. We meet on a Wednesday night at 7.30 pm. We meet at Guide Headquarters in Corporation Street. We play games,
